did.unittitle: Congregation Kether Torah, Pittsburgh, Pa. Historical Miscellanea
did.abstract: This collection contains miscellaneous records of Congregation Kether Torah (Pittsburgh, Pa.), including: history, charter, by-laws, membership lists from c. 1960, minutes of eight congregational meetings between 1927 and 1939, papers concerning the sale of the synagogue property in the Hill District, blueprint and legal documents concerning cemetery in Reserve Township, Pa., some general correspondence and a blueprint of synagogue from c. 1913.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: This synagogue, originally named Kaiser Torah, was founded at the corner of Webster Avenue and Erin Street in the Hill District, Pittsburgh, Pa. In 1922, it changed its name to Congregation Kether Torah, and later, in the 1950s, moved to Bartlett Street in Squirrel Hill, Pittsburgh, Pa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains miscellaneous records including: history, charter, by-laws, membership lists from c. 1960, minutes of eight congregational meetings between 1927 and 1939, papers concerning the sale of the synagogue property in the Hill District, blueprint and legal documents concerning cemetery in Reserve Township, Pa., some general correspondence and a blueprint of synagogue from c. 1913.
